title.narrative: Fremme af anti-korruptions dagordenen i civilsamfundsorganisationer i Kina, engagement

description.narrative: Promoting Proactive Participation by the Civil Society in the Fight against Corruption in China

participating-org.narrative: Integrity Building and Governance Research Committee

title.narrative: 1. Empowered youth to lead a more transparent, accountable and fair society by embedding integrity and resisting corruption

description.narrative: Assessment of achieved results: IBGRC has worked to develop outreach to youth to combat corruption and promote youth integrity in university education in easy-to-understand and non-academic formats covering a broad spectrum of themes of particular relevance to students across China. In its initial phase, the project reached out to 20 universities and further expanded to 50 other universities. Within this framework, IBGRC has engaged with students and promoted integrity initiatives through an array of ways. Overall, the component has increased Chinese youth’s understanding of, support for and engagement in the fight against corruption. Comparing with the baseline year, there are now more students that engage in different integrity related activities, and more universities that have Student Integrity Associations with more Integrity Volunteers.

title.narrative: 1. Empowered youth to lead a more transparent, accountable and fair society by embedding integrity and resisting corruption

description.narrative: Assessment of achieved results: IBGRC has worked to develop outreach to youth to combat corruption and promote youth integrity in university education in easy-to-understand and non-academic formats covering a broad spectrum of themes of particular relevance to students across China. In its initial phase, the project reached out to 20 universities and further expanded to 50 other universities. Within this framework, IBGRC has engaged with students and promoted integrity initiatives through an array of ways. Overall, the component has increased Chinese youth’s understanding of, support for and engagement in the fight against corruption. Comparing with the baseline year, there are now more students that engage in different integrity related activities, and more universities that have Student Integrity Associations with more Integrity Volunteers.

comment.narrative: 1. Around 200,000 university students taking action against corruption 2. Increasein the target group's perception that theycan make a difference in the fight against corruption 3. Anti-corruption synergy is created among Youth Integrity Community 4. Strong network of seek teachers and coalitionis formed for further changes 5. Anti-corruption curritum are adopted by ten more universities

title.narrative: 2. To strengthen transparency, integrity and accountability in the public sector at local and national levels through evidence-based advocacy, solution-based approaches and civil society initiatives and encourage public participation in building an anti-

description.narrative: Assessment of achieved results: In order to support stronger networks of anti-corruption experts, the IBGRC has been working on adapting anti-corruption knowledge and solutions developed by the international anti-corruption movement to be disseminated in China. Overall, more proactive participation in civil society on the fight against corruption has been achieved through advocacy of the implementation of UNCAC. The independent civil society review report is the very first of its kind of activities in China, whereas the other published research and papers have greatly expanded the horizon of the study on UNCAC, which has been an exclusive government domain.

description.narrative: Assessment of achieved results: In order to support stronger networks of anti-corruption experts, the IBGRC has been working on adapting anti-corruption knowledge and solutions developed by the international anti-corruption movement to be disseminated in China. Overall, more proactive participation in civil society on the fight against corruption has been achieved through advocacy of the implementation of UNCAC. The independent civil society review report is the very first of its kind of activities in China, whereas the other published research and papers have greatly expanded the horizon of the study on UNCAC, which has been an exclusive government domain.

comment.narrative: Two advocacy campaigns or other advocacy related activities that focus on anti-corruption issues in the framework of conventions and standards

title.narrative: 1.1 To empower youth with knowledge, tools, materials and motivation to enable them to act with integrity

description.narrative: Enhance the integrity of young people and encourage a focus on anti-corruption.

title.narrative: 1.1 To empower youth with knowledge, tools, materials and motivation to enable them to act with integrity

description.narrative: Enhance the integrity of young people and encourage a focus on anti-corruption.

comment.narrative: Conducting one national Youth Integrity Survey, training 30 seed teachers on integrity and on advocacy and communication skills, developing and improving the national anti-corruption curriculum for university students and business schools centred on integrity core values and relevant to emerging youth leaders, and enrolling 100 Youth Integrity Ambassadors.

title.narrative: 1.2 To inspire, train and support Youth Integrity Ambassadors become change makers and take honest actions which benefit themselves, others and the environment

description.narrative: Strengthen the understanding and commitment of young people towards a more transparent and responsible society.

title.narrative: 1.2 To inspire, train and support Youth Integrity Ambassadors become change makers and take honest actions which benefit themselves, others and the environment

description.narrative: Strengthen the understanding and commitment of young people towards a more transparent and responsible society.

comment.narrative: Awarding Youth Integrity Ambassadors at national level, arranging two summer camps at national level, and arranging two Youth Integrity Education Events at International Anti-Corruption Day (IACD).

title.narrative: 2.2 To enable a better linked network of anti-corruption experts to emerge

description.narrative: To ensure transparent, integrity of public sector accountability at both local and national level through civil society advocacy.

title.narrative: 2.2 To enable a better linked network of anti-corruption experts to emerge

description.narrative: To ensure transparent, integrity of public sector accountability at both local and national level through civil society advocacy.

comment.narrative: Training of 30 stakeholders on advocacy skills and communication skills.

title.narrative: 2.1 To encourage more proactive participation by civil society in the fight against corruption through advocacy of UNCAC implementation in China

description.narrative: To ensure transparent, integrity of public sector accountability at both local and national level through civil society monitoring.

title.narrative: 2.1 To encourage more proactive participation by civil society in the fight against corruption through advocacy of UNCAC implementation in China

description.narrative: To ensure transparent, integrity of public sector accountability at both local and national level through civil society monitoring.

comment.narrative: Conducting a civil society review report on UNCAC implementation in China, publishing and disseminating tools developed by the international anti-corruption movement in China, and promoting success stories.
